abstract.p: Responding to the petition of local landlords Dulerao Mandloi and Tejkaran Mandloi, Maratha queen Ahilyabai Holkar instructs the revenue collector (kamavisdar) of district (pargana) Indore that in keeping with existing practice, the landlords ought to be informed of any fines that are exacted.

div.p:
द दंडवत The standalone 'द' is known as a दकार, or dakar, in the Marathi epistolographic tradition. Molesworth states that it stands for the salutation दंडवत, or dandavat, which an inferior would use when writing to a superior, for example if a non-Brahman writes to a Brahman. However, it has also been observed that a shloka attributed to the Yadava minister Hemadripant recommends this salutation when writing to anyone for whom one feels affection, which may be a more appropriate reading in this case. For further discussion with respect to a late-eighteenth century letter from Peshwa Madhavrao Narayan to the Dutch VOC, see Bellarykar, "Two Marathi Letters," p. 26-7. अखंडीत लक्ष्मी आलंकृत

Salutations. [To the] Master Adorned by Boundless Wealth,
honored by kings, [and] Rajashri Khando Baburao, kamavisdar of pargana Indore, [from the] affectionate Ahilyabai
Holkar, salutations. In the year six eighty one hundred
and one thousand [1186], Dulerao Mandloi and Tejkaran
Mandloi of the aforementioned pargana came to the government
and petitioned that out of good order, the fines
that are to be imposed should be imposed with our understanding.
Such a practice having been ongoing, these days
the mamledars do not give us evidence [of these fines].
Regarding this, a warning must be issued so
on this basis, this patra has been prepared. Therefore,
bring this former practice
to mind, and if previously the finesFrom here the main text continues on the verso.
took place with the understanding of the aforementioned Mandlois,
[and] now are not taking place [with their understanding], then
in accordance with former practice, henceforth too with their understanding
the work of the fines ought to be conducted. Take notice.
On the lunar date of 25 Safar. Why write more? Ovular black ink sealPrepared.
